pr_title: Adds support for AutoComplete. Test clean up

timeline.message: Adding enableAutoComplete to ReceiverOptions and ServiceBusClientBuilder.
Do not enable autocomplete by default on synchronous clients.
Adding test for receive and delete.

timeline.bodyText: This should be true by default. That was my understanding .
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText:
should we say disableAutoComplete because by default it it enable ? And do we need a boolean as args, it is already enabled and user can disable it.
disableAutoComplete() ?
timeline.author: hemanttanwar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -826,6 +842,21 @@ private boolean isRollingSessionReceiver() {
         private ServiceBusReceiverClientBuilder() {
         }
 
+        /**
+         * Enables auto-complete and auto-abandon of received messages. By default, a successfully processed message is
+         * {@link ServiceBusReceiverAsyncClient#complete(ServiceBusReceivedMessage) completed}. If an error happens when
+         * the message is processed, it is
+         * {@link ServiceBusReceiverAsyncClient#abandon(ServiceBusReceivedMessage) abandoned}.
+         *
+         * @param enableAutoComplete True to enable auto-complete and false otherwise.
+         *
+         * @return The modified {@link ServiceBusReceiverClientBuilder} object.
+         */
+        public ServiceBusReceiverClientBuilder enableAutoComplete(boolean enableAutoComplete) {

timeline.bodyText: This validateAndThrow(prefetch) , in other PR we were validating earlier when user is setting prefetch . Should't this go there.
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: I thought that we are also doing this for sync clients ?
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

replies.bodyText: Yes. It's for the callback model. The pull model will not have that.
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: should this be info , since we are taking care of this for user, It should not create some kind of alarm for them.
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need a generic type that extends ServiceBusReceivedMessageContext? Also, this reminds me that ServiceBusReceivedMessageContext should be marked final too.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: No reason. I have no qualms with making it specific.
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Why do we call  requestUnbounded()? The downstream should control the flow.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't have to be called if the message is null. Same for abandon too.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
If complete fails , there is chance that message will be processed twice because it will go back to queue.
For now, we should log and continue ?
But as part of for-ever loop, this should me delivered to user in their error handler with indication that we fail to complete.
replies.author: hemanttanwar
conniey

timeline.bodyText: Don't think we should call onError() here if the operation was to abandon. This will terminate the downstream. What is the expected behavior when a message cannot be completed successfully?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: Yes. We should terminate the downstream. I want to wrap this with a retry().
replies.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: This operator is just to complete/abandon. . . if it fails, it'll pass it downstream. the retries and infinite one is out of scope for this PR.
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: For the processor, autocomplete should still be possible right? So, the async client has to be built with autocomplete enabled by default.
timeline.author: srnagar

It is also thrown if the Service Bus {@link + * #connectionString(String) connectionString} contains an {@code EntityPath} that does not match one set in + * {@link #queueName(String) queueName} or {@link #topicName(String) topicName}. Lastly, if a {@link + * #topicName(String) topicName} is set, but {@link #subscriptionName(String) subscriptionName} is not. + * @throws IllegalArgumentException Queue or topic name are not set via {@link #queueName(String) + * queueName()} or {@link #topicName(String) topicName()}, respectively. + */ + public ServiceBusReceiverClient buildClient() { + return new ServiceBusReceiverClient(buildAsyncClient(false), retryOptions.getTryTimeout());

timeline.bodyText: Same as above. Async client should be built with autocomplete enabled for the processor. We may have to find a different way to disable it on the receive() method on the sync client.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: verbose ? since it does not help in regular scenario.
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: Like we spoke above test for scenario where onComplete, onAbandon fails.
timeline.author: hemanttanwar
